instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2330: What is 820-2330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.

threads.title: no fan spin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> but green light
threads.message:
hello friends, i am just working on that board, the airflow is stuffed full of dirt

had green light no fan spin

figured out that on <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> only 0.3V, replaced like recommended

after that board is working

i put it back in the case, fasten all srews and no fan spin but green light same like before, chekced <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S5_MCP</SIGNAL> this time is ok

i think that <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> is a common fail. so has somebody experience what to do now? could it be an option that there are cracks under the MCP and during i heated <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> to solder that

the cracks opened?

I dont want mess it up with a mcp reflow

threads.title: no fan spin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> but green light
threads.message: You solder <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> with normal soldering iron. No idea what is wrong at this point...

threads.title: no fan spin <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> but green light
threads.message:
i used hot air.


Edit:

I just found the problem.

I used a bigger one a 7.3mm smd condensator. but it was too big for that small place, i scratched already a bit from the board to solder it right
but it was on one side only touching the pad, 

thanks.
